entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Delete PDF streams when PDF content hosts are deleted
entry.content:
Delete PDF streams when PDF content hosts are deleted, to avoid breaking

PdfViewerStreamManager state if the content host is deleted but not the

PDF embedder host or the PDF extension host.



This is a follow-up of https://crrev.com/c/5350161, which deletes the

PDF stream when the PDF extension host is deleted.

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Produce accessible alerts on updates
entry.content:
This CL adds functionality to DownloadBubbleUpdateService that uses the

DownloadBubbleAccessibleAlertsMap to store and return accessible alerts

when downloads are updated. The AlertsMap is stored as a member of each

DownloadBubbleUpdateService::CacheManager, and is updated alongside (but

separately from) the display info. We have to take care not to announce

spurious alerts for downloads loaded from history during startup, so

this also adds functionality to the DownloadBubbleUpdateService to

ignore any alerts generated before the DownloadHistory completes its

history query.



Note that this relies on the steady beat of update calls through the

download system in order to drive the alerts. This means that alerts are

not emitted when nothing is actively downloading.



Adds a new alert string and removes Mac vs non-Mac variations of the

existing alert strings because they referred to the "downloads bar"

which is no longer in use.



In the next CL, these alerts will be fetched from the update service by

the DownloadDisplayController, and announced through the View from

there.



Bug: 40926583

entry.title: [ios] Fix autofill data dropped by js framework
entry.content:
The page linked to the bug seems to be over writing autofilled data.

fill_util.ts::setInputElementValue tries to simulate the data

propagation events resulting from the user entering data in a field

(User input -> input event fired -> property setter involved). This is

done to avoid breaking JS frameworks that handle user input and expect

this order of events.



Autofill's solution to mimic user input data propagation events

consists of temporarily overriding the value property of the input

field so the getter returns the autofilled value. This is followed by

firing the events related to the value of the input changing. Finally,

the property is restored to its previous implementation.



In the page linked to the bug, the code handling user input doesn't

call the setter after the events are fired and there seems to be

some async code that is reverting the field value. There is some

state somewhere in the framework that is not being properly updated

when autofill fires the events. Setting the value of the property

after the events were fired and the setter wasn't called seems to

fix the issue.



Bug: 328568970

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Delete PDF streams when PDF extension hosts are deleted
entry.content:
Delete PDF streams when PDF extension hosts are deleted, to avoid

breaking PdfViewerStreamManager state if the extension host is deleted

but not the PDF embedder host.



https://crrev.com/1262001 added shadow DOM to the PDF embed in the

injected HTML for the PDF viewer. This was to prevent embedders from

accessing and manipulating the PDF extension frame and content frame.

Unfortunately, embedders can still manipulate the document.body of the

injected HTML. Scripts can replace the document.body, deleting the

extension frame and content frame, but not the PDF embedder frame. This

can break certain assumptions the PdfViewerStreamManager makes.



To counter this, delete the PDF stream when the PDF extension host is

deleted, so that the PdfViewerStreamManager won't interact with the

original PDF embedder frame and its children anymore.



Bug: 328474391

entry.title: [E2E] Fix NPE due to window inset consumer race
entry.content:
It's possible for the viewport-fit to change multiple times before the

registered WindowInsetsConsumer is invoked, leading to NPEs when trying

to access mSystemInsets in #adjustEdges.



Checking for null mSystemInsets before invoking #adjustEdges

in #drawToEdge and adds two regression tests to prevent future crashes.

entry.title: [commerce] Update ShoppingService to deal with unified BookmarkModel
entry.content:
The main principle is that components/commerce needs to handle the

co-existence of local bookmarks and account bookmarks in the same

BookmarkModel instance. In order to do so, it can lean on the

IsLocalOnlyNode() predicate introduced in

https://crrev.com/c/5371727.



Tests run into the additional challenge that they need to mimic

sync being on, as otherwise most of the price tracking

functionality remains off. In order to do so without big

refactorings, BookmarkSyncService is extended with a test-only API.

entry.title: Detect shutting down Telephony in PlatNetworksManager
entry.content:
In rare circumstances, when Telephony service is crashing or shutting

down for other reasons, when Chrome requests Cell Info update -

it receives an IllegalStateException.



There seems to be no mechanism allowing us to (cheaply)

evaluate whether TelephonyService is usable (it is internal to

TelephonyManager), and the exception appears to be the only thing

that indicates a problem.



This change introduces a simple try/catch block, communicating back

an empty CellInfo update structure if the TelephonyService appears

to be unusable at the time of call.



It makes no sense to plumb the call to getAllCellInfo(), since that

call will return null, too.



Change-Id: I8052bccd16b9af8576b516b09918a8eb9ea8f143

Fixed: 329608452

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5378460

Commit-Queue: Tomasz Wiszkowski

Reviewed-by: Patrick Noland

entry.title: Allow sharing of AudioRenderMixers within a main frame.
entry.content:
It's common for a page to have a lot of YouTube embeds. With the current

code, none of those embeds share a mixer and thus can trigger the 50

physical stream limit quickly.



Similar to the previous attempt, this improves sharing within a process

for AudioRendererMixers. a6068ebab3469d9d7793381987b1168434afaabe took

this sharing too far, enabling sharing across multiple main frames. The

correct approach is to only allow sharing between RenderFrames belonging

to the same main frame. I've verified that all reported regressions work

with this approach.



Unlike the previous attempt, this isn't limited to default devices, since that was never actually necessary. Every AudioRendererMixerInput

already has to individually authorize before getting a mixer that can

be shared. I've promoted some DCHECKs to CHECKs to ensure this happens.



Bug: 314766691, 327489297, 327884890, 40719184

Change-Id: I4a9116d600cba18877c1fdfec08339f86066bc4a

entry.title: [Fluent Scrollbar] Deferring typeface initialization to first PaintArrow
entry.content:
On instantiation, NativeThemeFluent queries the DefaultFontManager and

tries to fetch the font to draw scrollbar arrows with, which will be

used in NativeThemeFluent::PaintArrow().

In many tests, when FluentScrollbars are enabled, this causes issues

because tests can be particular about wanting to instantiate font

managers or configs in a specific order which is disrupted when the

NativeTheme instantiates a FontManager before the desired order. This

has been the cause for some tests needing rewriting in the past [1,2,3]



In many of these tests, the NativeTheme gets instantiated to check

things like the color scheme, and paint calls are never actually called.



This CL defers the call to fetch the typeface to the first call to

PaintArrow, to avoid unnecessary instantiations and lazily load the

fonts.



[1] https://crrev.com/4257851

[2] https://crrev.com/5111784

[3] https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/linux-rel/1736279/test-results?sortby=&groupby=&q=renderthread+



Bug: 329489158

Change-Id: If66c1f569bdbf7a9b4d964c361d69f54f7f225d8

entry.title: WebUI: Disallow extension-less JS imports via ESLint, part 1.
entry.content:
In this part fixing all occurrences in the codebase, but not actually

turning on the ESLint check yet.



Per the JS styleguide at [1] all JS import statements should explicitly

specify the file extension. The TS styleguide does not seem to have

that requirement and shows examples where the extension is omitted [2].



Given the prevalence of non-extensionless imports in Chromium's

codebase it seems better to enforce the JS styleguide for both JS and

TS to be consistent with the vast majority of existing code.



[1] https://google.github.io/styleguide/jsguide.html#es-module-imports

[2] https://google.github.io/styleguide/tsguide.html#imports

entry.title: Optimize how relative transform of a layer is calculated
entry.content:
Currently in the implementation of SynchronizeLayerTreeRoundedCorners(),

for each layer we calculate the relative transform w.r.t to the

root_layer using Layer::GetTargetTransformRelativeTo(). This function

traverses through the parent chain to calculate the transform.



This gets expensive as we do this operation for multiple layers and the

parent chain becomes longer.



To optimize this, we calculate this transform as we traverse the layer

tree.

entry.title: Prepare to convert SBThreatType to an enum class in ['/components/security_interstitials', '/components/security_state']
entry.content:
It's somewhat difficult to log an SBThreatType as an UMA histogram since

we don't have a kMaxValue. We can't simply add a kMaxValue because

SBThreatType is an enum instead of enum class, and we'd be exposing a

constant safe_browsing::kMaxValue. This CL prepares to convert

SBThreatType to an enum class in ['/components/security_interstitials', '/components/security_state'].



That requires two changes:



- SBThreatType is no longer implicitly convertible to int, so we will

need a few static casts



- SBThreatType values are now in the namespace

safe_browsing::SBThreatType instead of just safe_browsing. In some

places this is fixed by adding the new namespace, and in some places

with a "using enum" declaration. We can't just add a "using enum" for

all usages of SBThreatType because "using enum" would declare a

constant kMaxValue. So "using enum" is only used when many

SBThreatType constants are used, and in as narrow a scope as possible.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: [WebAuthn] Make fake UV key provider use wrapped keys as labels
entry.content:
Now that UV key providers assign labels, rather than accepting them

from the caller, the fake provider implementation can store wrapped

unexportable keys in them and therefore we no longer need the singleton

map.



This also makes UserVerifyingKeyLabel a string on all platforms. Since

it is used on Mac and Windows, and there aren't immediate plans to

implement this on anything else, it is easier for testing just to have

it be consistent.



That change means the fake key provider can be built on all platforms.

entry.title: Support early start of Print Backend service
entry.content:
Add a feature parameter to allow for early starting a Print Backend

service.



When this parameter is enabled, it causes a Print Backend service to be

launched right after all of the main browser startup tasks have

completed. The PrintBackendServiceManager treats the service as

persistent, so that it is not destroyed after a period of idleness.

Any subsequently created services (such as a relaunch if a service

crashed) will also persist indefinitely.

entry.title: wayland: suppress pointer button release events
entry.content:
...when received after the drag session has effectively started.



Otherwise, it may result in broken UX as observed in the linked crbug.



Currently, there's no reliable way in the Wayland protocol to determine

when (or whether) the drag session has effectively started, so as a

best-effort heuristic we consider it started once wl_data_device.enter

has been received at least once.

entry.title: [A11y] Remove class name changed, which is unused
entry.content:
A number of events were added in CL:1510772 without use cases, early

on when Microsoft was getting accustomed to the codebase, to ensure

that every potential property change had a matching event.



After talking with Microsoft, it appears that this event and others

were added in CL:1510772 without having any use cases in hand.

It's easy enough to re-add if necessary.



As discovered in CL:5367566, firing events for every possible

property change is an expensive proposition, and when possible we should limit change events to those with known or likely cases.

entry.title: Increase arbitrary offset limit in pefile.py
entry.content:
In an attempt to detect corrupt files pefile.py imposes an arbitrary

maximum offset of 0x10000000 (256 MiB). However Chrome's dcheck official

builds exceed that limit which means that uploading of symbols started

failing. This change increases the limit to 1 GiB.



An issue has been filed against the pefile project for a long-term fix

but this fix will unblock dcheck official builds for now.



https://github.com/erocarrera/pefile/issues/396

entry.title: [Interop] Don't use aria-label if it's only whitespace
entry.content:
Per step 2D of the accname computation steps [1], the aria-label should

only be used if it is not the empty string and not the empty string

when trimmed of whitespace.



Update Blink to consider the whitespace trimming part of that check.



Making that change, I observed a comment instructing me to make a

corresponding change to AXNodeObject::nameFromLabelElement, but no

such function exists. It was changed to IsNameFromLabelElement in [2]

and part of that was further refactored into IsNameFromAriaAttribute

in [3]. So, I've updated the comments to reference the new functions.



The `IsHiddenForTextAlternativeCalculation` check following one of

those comments seems to have no exact corresponding logic, since

its counterpart was removed in [2] without a replacement.

That seems to be by-design since several levels above in the

call stack, `AXLayoutObject::ComputeAccessibilityIsIgnored`

checks `AXObject::ShouldIgnoreForHiddenOrInert`.

I've simply deleted the comment recommending an update to

nameFromLabelElement in this case.



[1] https://w3c.github.io/accname/#comp_label

[2] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2822769

[3] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2831133

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Give embedded PDFs in data: URLs local storage access
entry.content:
Explicitly allow PDF extension frames to have local storage access.



The PDF extension needs local storage access to save if the user last

kept the side navigation bar collapsed or open. Security checks only

allow storage access if the frame's origin is non-opaque. According to

the web spec, frames in a data: URL's document have opaque origins. This

means PDFs in data: URLs cannot access local storage and fail to load.



It should be sufficient to check if the frame origin is the PDF

extension origin and if the frame has a parent. Only the PDF extension

frame should have the extension origin, and webpages cannot have iframes

that navigate directly to the URL (the navigation is blocked). The

parent check is necessary to avoid giving storage access if a user were

to navigate to the PDF extension URL as the main frame.



Bug: 325314713

Change-Id: Ieb62fb74fa8c11f42513e59f510569c9f1842170

entry.title: Reland "Allow child processes to inherit logging file handle on Windows"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit b80a478f9f8bff1fb9001d249ca8c09105fd3405



Previously win_asan failed ContentBrowserTest.RendererCrashCallStack

as the stack was not being sent out on stderr. The Sanitizer

machinery in llvm only allows a single output handle to be provided

and the change caused a file rather than stderr to be used. This

is fixed by adding `--enable-logging=stderr` as an option that

content_shell understands (it does the same thing as chrome, and only

logs to stderr and any internal debuglog). Passing this argument from

the test launcher now allows the test to pass.



Original change's description:

> Allow child processes to inherit logging file handle on Windows

>

> Child processes on Windows cannot always open their log file

> (for instance if they cannot determine the user-data-dir) making

> configuration of logging complicated. Child processes also need

> a sandbox exception to open their log files.

>

> This CL replaces logging related flags to pass a handle to children

> in cases where a file would have been passed, allowing a later CL

> to remove the sandbox rule allowing direct access to the log file.

>

> If the browser is run with `--enable-logging --log-file=file`,

> children will now be run with `--enable-logging=handle --log-file=N`.

> It is not possible to mix stderr logging with file logging (it will

> still work for the browser process), but this already does not work

> in official builds as std handles are not passed into children.

>

> This also allows the CHROME_LOG_FILE to be useful again for renderer

> processes if Chrome is run using:

>

> $env:CHROME_LOG_FILE="d:\temp\env-log.log"

> chrome.exe --enable-logging

>

> the browser will inspect the env var and provide a handle to that

> file when starting renderer processes.

>

> Running the browser with --enable-logging=handle directly is not

> supported, these flags should only be provided by the browser when

entry.title: WebGPU: Expose D3D shader model and Vulkan driver version properly
entry.content:
This CL fixes [1] and [2] by exposing properly non-standard

d3dShaderModel and vkDriverVersion adapter info attributes upon calling

requestAdapterInfo() when the user has enabled the "WebGPU Developer

Features" flag.



Note that it also fixes an issue where memoryHeaps adapter info

attribute was exposed only with the "Unsage WebGPU support" flag. It

should also be exposed [3] when the user has enabled the "WebGPU

Developer Features" flag.



[1]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366599

[2]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5374310

entry.title: [Extensions] Fix opening side panel in split mode incognito
entry.content:
This resolves an issue where split mode extensions couldn't open a side

panel for a specified window or tab ID in an incognito window, due to

the SidePanelService always using the browser context it was created

with. Instead, now we pass the browser context across from the

ExtensionFunction that is calling into it.



Also adds a test for opening the panel for a given incognito tab ID or

incognito window ID for a split mode extension.

entry.title: Package protect TabGroupTitleUtils#storeTabGroupTitle().
entry.content:
Reading and writing directly to SharedPreferences from a static util

make it hard to control access, emit events, and migrate id schemes.

This CL starts to move us in the correct direction by moving

#storeTabGroupTitle to be package protected, forcing clients to go

through the TabGroupModelFilter to access the functionality.



Created pass-through #getTabGroupTitle(), although almost no call

sites use it yet. This was mainly to support tests that rely on mocks. Also created unused observer event #didChangeTabGroupTitle() for

future use.

entry.title: Add IPC implementation for Android WebView Media Integrity
entry.content:
Adds renderer-side and browser-side implementations of the Android

WebView Media Integrity API, along with Mojom interface definitions.



The browser side of the Mojo interface is implemented in Java. The

underlying logic for token provision is delegated to a

platform-provided implementation via PlatformServiceBridge, but

browser-renderer IPC is handled entirely within Chromium code.

entry.title: [Passwords] Exclude 1-symbol name inputs from single username flows
entry.content:
Currently, Password Manager does not consider nameless fields for

UFF voting, because a single nameless text field can be anything, and

is likely to cause aggregation of many unrelated fields on the server.

However, 1-symbol long inputs are also not meaningful, and cause the

same problems.



This CL:

1) Extends the voting check in the renderer to also ignore 1-symbol

long field names.

2) Adds the same check in the form parser to ignore the existing

predictions for such fields.

entry.title: Reland "ozone/drm: Retry test modesets w/ all possible CRTC-connector permutations"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 1846ac9e49f1d034c546fa11534319415a9bbaac



Disable certain tests in LSAN build that leak DrmDevice due to cyclic

dependency. Refer to b/40263526 for more details on the cyclic

dependency.



Original change's description:

> ozone/drm: Retry test modesets w/ all possible CRTC-connector permutations

>

> The kernel sometimes uses multiple CRTCs for a single connector without

> marking the CRTC as in use to userspace. One such case is when

> Bigjoiner (an intel driver feature) takes an additional CRTC for high

> bandwidth modes. Modesetting with a stolen CRTC will result in failure.

> The only way to work around additional CRTCs being taken is to test

> modeset on various CRTC-connector permutations, and to use the

> permutation that doesn’t fail.

>

> This CL adds a fallback logic on test modeset failure.

> The fallback logic generates all possible permutations of

> CRTC-connector pairings given each connectors’ possible CRTCs, and

> tries to test modeset on all of them. The fallback will immediately

> terminate upon the first test modeset success.

>

> Ozone will revert any changes to its abstractions that were made during

> the fallback attempts, such that the original CRTC-connector pairings

> before the configure request are maintained. Maintaining the original

> pairings is necessary as pageflips with old display state might

> interleave the UI's fallback test modesets. GetNativeDisplays()

> attempts to maintain stability of CRTC-connector pairings whenever

> possible, which leads to dramatically decreased chances of pageflip

> failure (which results in GPU process crash).

>

> high-bandwidth display

>

> Bug: b:322831691, b:303194009

> Test: ozone_unittests && display_unittests && manual testing w/

> Change-Id: I3c747032067b2d4a2d8ab8974f59d7d2dbe53c65

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5301492

> Commit-Queue: Su Hong Koo

> Reviewed-by: Gil Dekel

> Reviewed-by: Mark PMNKHME

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1272971}



Bug: b:322831691, b:303194009

entry.title: CCA: Implement ScreenLockedMonitor for CCA to monitor screen lock state
entry.content:
Since idleDetector polls screen lock state every 15 seconds now, it may

causes a privacy issue if CCA relies on it to start/stop capture. This

CL implements ScreenLockedMonitor for CCA to monitor screen lock state.

With it, CCA can start/stop capture with no delay when the lock state of

screen is changed.

entry.title: android: Propagate Window.getDecorView() to the native InputHintChecker
entry.content:
In ChromeActivity.onResumeWithNative() grab a weak reference to

getWindow().getDecorView() and set it for the native InputHintChecker to

use later. The InputHintChecker will need to be initialized before

HasInput() can access the hint on that View. Async initialization will

land separately.



It is important that we propagate the result of getDecorView() because

it is a root view that can reach out to the corresponding InputChannel

(the Android-side abstraction).



Disable input hint checking when in multi-window mode for simplicity.

Walking through Views for each of the visible windows would need a more

sophisticated latency/overhead tradeoff investigation.



Bug: 326417367

entry.title: Prepare to convert SBThreatType to an enum class in ['/components/safe_browsing/content/browser', '/components/safe_browsing']
entry.content:
It's somewhat difficult to log an SBThreatType as an UMA histogram since

we don't have a kMaxValue. We can't simply add a kMaxValue because

SBThreatType is an enum instead of enum class, and we'd be exposing a

constant safe_browsing::kMaxValue. This CL prepares to convert

SBThreatType to an enum class in ['/components/safe_browsing/content/browser', '/components/safe_browsing'].



That requires two changes:



- SBThreatType is no longer implicitly convertible to int, so we will

need a few static casts



- SBThreatType values are now in the namespace

safe_browsing::SBThreatType instead of just safe_browsing. In some

places this is fixed by adding the new namespace, and in some places

with a "using enum" declaration. We can't just add a "using enum" for

all usages of SBThreatType because "using enum" would declare a

constant kMaxValue. So "using enum" is only used when many

SBThreatType constants are used, and in as narrow a scope as possible.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.content:
It's somewhat difficult to log an SBThreatType as an UMA histogram since

we don't have a kMaxValue. We can't simply add a kMaxValue because

SBThreatType is an enum instead of enum class, and we'd be exposing a

constant safe_browsing::kMaxValue. This CL prepares to convert

SBThreatType to an enum class in ['/chrome/browser/safe_browsing', '/components/safe_browsing/android', '/components/safe_browsing/core/browser/db', '/components/safe_browsing/core/browser/hashprefix_realtime', '/components/safe_browsing/core/browser/realtime'].



That requires two changes:



- SBThreatType is no longer implicitly convertible to int, so we will

need a few static casts



- SBThreatType values are now in the namespace

safe_browsing::SBThreatType instead of just safe_browsing. In some

places this is fixed by adding the new namespace, and in some places

with a "using enum" declaration. We can't just add a "using enum" for

all usages of SBThreatType because "using enum" would declare a

constant kMaxValue. So "using enum" is only used when many

SBThreatType constants are used, and in as narrow a scope as possible.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.

entry.title: Make kPersonallyIdentifiableStatusFields a constexpr variable
entry.content:
This was actually being initialized at runtime, since the initializer

was not a constant expression. base::MakeFixedFlatMap is stricter and

requiring consteval, so fixing this consists of two parts:

- marking `kPersonallyIdentifiableStatusFields` itself as constexpr

- making all the policy keys constexpr



The latter has some implications in component builds: specifically, it

is possible for the constants to be built into multiple discrete

components, breaking things that rely on pointer identity. This

dependency does not seem to be there in practice, and Chrome should

prioritize optimizing for production builds that ship to users over

developer-only component builds.



This also changes a use of base::StringPiece to std::string_view.

entry.title: [ios] Handle absence of account permanent bookmark folders
entry.content:
Behavioral changes only behind disabled feature flag.



When `syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage` is enabled,

account permanent folders are supported via dedicated functions in

BookmarkModel API, such as `BookmarkModel::account_mobile_node()`.



These APIs can return null and transitioning from and to null is

notified to observers via folder creation and removal. In this patch,

several of these codepaths are fixed, as surfaced by EG tests when

attempting to enable the feature in bots.

entry.title: Extend the V8 benchmarking extension to allow retrieving Renderer
entry.content:
pid/tids.



This change allows JavaScript to get the process and thread ids for

Renderer processes/threads. This is useful for profiling programs (such

as Android's simpleperf) to selectively profile the Renderer process or

threads.



Note: Setting `No-Presubmit` since this change just modifies an

existing v8::Extension, and does not add a new extension. The

following presubmit fails otherwise:

```

Do not introduce new v8::Extensions into the code base, use

gin::Wrappable instead. See http://crbug.com/334679

```



No-Presubmit: true
